{{cpp/title|integral}}
{{cpp/concepts/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=concepts|since=c++20|1=
template&lt; class T &gt;
concept integral = std::is_integral_v&lt;T&gt;;
}}

The concept {{c|integral&lt;T&gt;}} is satisfied if and only if {{tt|T}} is an integral type.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;concepts&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
 
void print(std::integral auto i)
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Integral: " &lt;&lt; i &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
 
void print(auto x)
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Non-integral: " &lt;&lt; x &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
 
int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha;

    static_assert(std::integral&lt;bool&gt;);
    print(true);

    static_assert(std::integral&lt;char&gt;);
    print('o');

    static_assert(std::integral&lt;int&gt;);
    print(007);

    static_assert( ! std::integral&lt;double&gt; );
    print(2e2);

    static_assert( ! std::integral&lt;decltype("")&gt; );
    print("∫∫∫");
}
|output=
Integral: true
Integral: o
Integral: 7
Non-integral: 200
Non-integral: ∫∫∫
}}
